definitions.definition: Precept or warning against evil or danger of any kind; exhortation to wariness; advice; injunction; prudence in regard to danger; provident care
A careful attention to the probable effects of an act, in order that failure or harm may be avoided
definitions.example: The guideline expressed caution against excessive radiographic imaging.

definitions.definition: One who draws attention or causes astonishment by their behaviour.
definitions.example: Oh, that boy, he's a caution! He does make me laugh.

definitions.definition: A formal warning given as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases.
To warn; to alert, advise that caution is warranted.
